thread.title: ISL 2: Delhi Dynamos pip Kerala Blasters 1-0
thread.title_full: ISL 2: Delhi Dynamos pip Kerala Blasters 1-0 - Sports

author: PTI
title: ISL 2: Delhi Dynamos pip Kerala Blasters 1-0
text:
Kochi: Ghanaian striker Richard Gadze's late strike in the 87th minute ensured third straight victory for Delhi Dynamos as they beat hosts Kerala Blasters 1-0 in the Indian Super League football tournament yesterday.


Richard Gadze of Delhi Dynamos celebrates after scoring. Pic/ISL 
Substitute Gadze headed home a Florent Malouda cross as he timed his jump to perfection heading home from close range much to the dismay of the home fans and team's owner Sachin Tendulkar, who graced the stands.
Dynamos now have nine points from four games and are second in the league table behind FC Pune City.
Dynamos started on a positive note as Robin Singh's shot was saved by opposition goalie Stephen Bywater. In the fifth minute, Francis Fernandes provided a defence splitting through for Gustavo Dos Santos but the Brazilian's first touch wasn't a great one and by the time he took the second stroke, Bywater anticipated to collect the ball.
Peter Ramage had a good game at the heart of the Blasters defence as he kept out the dangerous floaters sent from right by the Malouda.
Locked goalless at half-time, profligate Robin missed the chance of the match in the 67th minute after he had sights of an open goal from a rebound which he shot over. Finally, it was Gadze, who brought smiles in the face of Dynamos manager Roberto Carlos with a perfect header.
ISL top 5 standings 
FC Pune
Delhi Dynamos
Atletico de Kolkata
FC Goa
Chennaiyin FC
